coverage_summary: Household Buildings and Contents Insurance designed to provide cover for loss or damage to your property, including buildings (unlimited sum insured) and contents (selectable sum insured between £75,000 and £300,000). Includes worldwide temporary removal cover for contents and various liability coverages.
key_inclusions: Loss or damage to contents in home or temporarily removed anywhere in the world up to contents sum insured
Contents sum insured selectable between £75,000 and £300,000
Loss or damage including accidental damage to buildings
Valuables up to 40% of contents sum insured per claim
Alternative accommodation up to maximum 3 years
Tenant's liability up to 20% of contents sum insured
Liability to domestic staff up to £10,000,000
Jury service up to £25 per day or £5,000 per claim
key_exclusions: Loss or damage caused gradually or by wear and tear, depreciation, effects of light or atmosphere, mould, dry or wet rot or fungus
Costs arising from normal use, maintenance and upkeep of buildings and contents
Loss or damage after home has been unoccupied or unfurnished caused by malicious people, theft or attempted theft, escape of water or oil
Loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood
Chewing, scratching, tearing, fouling or urinating by domestic animals
Vehicles or craft, or liability from owning, possessing or using vehicles or craft
Theft from vehicles or craft unless all windows and doors closed, all openings securely locked, and reasonable precautions taken to conceal items from view
Loss or damage arising from alteration or extension of buildings
Any identity theft connected with business, profession or occupation
Loss or damage caused or allowed deliberately, wilfully, maliciously, illegally or unlawfully by you or your family or anyone lawfully in the home

coverage_limits.valuables_per_claim: Up to 40% of contents sum insured
coverage_limits.replacement_locks: Up to contents or buildings sums insured

sub_limits.home_assistance_optional_per_claim: £1,000 including VAT for callout and temporary repairs
sub_limits.home_assistance_max_claims_per_year: No more than 3 claims in any 12 month period

special_conditions: You and your family must take precautions to avoid injury, loss or damage
Take reasonable steps to safeguard property from loss or damage
For Home Assistance: property must be properly maintained
For Home Assistance: boiler and heating system must be serviced by qualified person in accordance with manufacturer's guidelines
Must produce relevant identification including boiler service receipts on demand for Home Assistance
Must co-operate in obtaining reimbursement of costs from third parties
Must notify us of any changes including change of address, structural alterations, letting the home, if home will be unoccupied, bankruptcy, or police cautions/convictions
excess_deductible: You will need to pay an amount of each claim, known as the excess. All excess amounts are listed in your policy schedule. These amounts may vary depending on your voluntary excess choices.
geographical_coverage: The United Kingdom for main home insurance. Contents temporarily removed covered anywhere in the world. Optional Family Legal Protection covers UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and European Union.
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling-off period from receipt of policy documents. Full refund if cover has not started. Pro-rata refund if cover has started, provided no claims have occurred. Can cancel anytime with written notice - pro-rata refund as long as no eligible claims made during coverage period. If any claims made, no refund of premium.

endorsements.name: Home Assistance
endorsements.description: Underwritten by Inter Partner Assistance S.A. Provides up to £1,000 inc VAT for callout and temporary repairs for: plumbing issues (leaking pipes, blocked drains, leaking radiators), toilet waste pipe blockages, central heating/boiler failure, total electricity failure, pests (wasps, squirrels, rats, mice), broken/damaged windows, doors & locks presenting security risk
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds emergency home repair services. Excludes: LPG/oil/solid fuel fired systems, renewable heating, un-vented systems, boilers over 60 Kw/hr, boilers over 15 years old, replacement of external overflows/cylinders/tanks/radiators/sanitary ware, detached outbuildings & garages, unserviced boilers/heating systems, boilers beyond economical repair, pests outside main dwelling, descaling/power flushing/sludge damage, routine maintenance. Limited to 3 claims per 12 months.

endorsements.name: Family Legal Protection
endorsements.description: Provided by Arc Legal Assistance Limited (FCA 305958). Covers legal advisers' costs for: breach of contract for goods/services, personal injury compensation claims, employment tribunal/contract breach claims, nuisance/trespass actions, property damage actions, defending motoring prosecutions, defending consumer contract breach claims, HMRC Full Enquiry accountancy fees, data protection breach claims, Local Education Authority admission policy appeals
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds legal expense coverage. Excludes: claims with less than 51% prospects of success, unapproved costs, pre-inception incidents, disputes under £125 (plus VAT) for consumer claims, conflicts with other insured parties, costs covered by other insurance. Restrictions: can use own legal representative after court proceedings issued but only at standard adviser rates, 90-day qualifying period for employment claims, 180-day qualifying period for property infringement claims, responsible for costs if withdrawing without consent. Must notify within 180 days of incident.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible. For Family Legal Protection: within 180 days of becoming aware of insured incident
required_documents: All relevant information about the claim
For Home Assistance: relevant identification including boiler service receipts
For Family Legal Protection: all information required to decide if claim may be accepted (supplied at your expense)
process_steps: Provide all relevant information to assist in validating the claim
Take steps to prevent further damage
Do not dispose of any damaged items before inspection
Do not conduct permanent repairs before inspection
For Home Assistance: call as soon as aware of home emergency
For Family Legal Protection: gain consent before incurring legal advisers' costs
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Must not dispose of damaged items or conduct permanent repairs as insurer may need to inspect damage. For Home Assistance: must produce boiler service receipts and identification on demand. For Family Legal Protection: must supply all information required at own expense.
claims_requirements.claims_contact: AXA Personal Lines Customer Service, PO Box 7072, Willenhall, WV1 9ZU (for cancellations - claims contact not specified in this document)

eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Identity theft coverage excludes theft connected with business, profession or occupation
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Private residences in The United Kingdom
other_restrictions: Must be for private residential purposes only
Must notify if intending to let the home or use for any reason other than private residential purposes
Must notify if you or family have been declared bankrupt
Must notify if you or family have received police caution or been convicted/charged with any offence
Coverage restricted when home is unoccupied or unfurnished

policy_definitions.unoccupied: See policy booklet for definition - affects coverage for malicious damage, theft, water/oil escape
policy_definitions.unfurnished: See policy booklet for definition - affects coverage for malicious damage, theft, water/oil escape
policy_definitions.vehicles_or_craft: See policy booklet for definition - excluded from coverage
policy_definitions.valuables: Items with special value limits - up to 40% of contents sum insured per claim, individual items up to £15,000 (£25,000 if specified)
policy_definitions.contents: Items in home or temporarily removed anywhere in the world
policy_definitions.buildings: The structure of the property - unlimited sum insured
policy_definitions.family: Includes you and your family members living in the home
policy_definitions.excess: The amount you pay towards each claim

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: 90 days for Employment claims under Family Legal Protection; 180 days for Property Infringement claims under Family Legal Protection
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Family Legal Protection: must notify within 180 days of becoming aware of insured incident; Home Assistance: call as soon as aware of emergency
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: As soon as possible once aware of loss or damage; Family Legal Protection: within 180 days of becoming aware of incident
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from receipt of policy documents for full refund (if cover not started) or pro-rata refund (if no claims made)

Key features include unlimited buildings cover, selectable contents cover £75k-£300k, worldwide temporary removal, liability covers up to £10m, optional Home Assistance and Family Legal Protection.

common_questions.question: What is the maximum I can claim for a single valuable item?
common_questions.answer: £15,000 for any one valuable or personal effect, unless the item is specifically listed on your policy, in which case the limit is £25,000

common_questions.question: Am I covered if my home is empty?
common_questions.answer: Coverage is restricted when the home is unoccupied or unfurnished. Loss or damage caused by malicious people, theft or attempted theft, or escape of water or oil is not covered after the home has been unoccupied or unfurnished. You must notify the insurer if your home will be unoccupied.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured? - page 1; What are my obligations? - page 3

common_questions.question: Can I get a refund if I cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Within 14 days of receiving documents: full refund if cover hasn't started, or pro-rata refund if no claims made. After 14 days: pro-rata refund as long as no claims made during coverage period. If any claims have been made, no refund is available.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract? - pages 3-4

common_questions.question: Are my contents covered when I take them abroad?
common_questions.answer: Yes, contents are covered while temporarily removed anywhere in the world up to the contents sum insured
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured? - page 1; Where am I covered? - page 3

common_questions.question: What emergency repairs are covered under Home Assistance?
common_questions.answer: Plumbing issues (leaking pipes, blocked drains, radiators), toilet blockages, central heating/boiler failure, total electricity failure, pests (wasps, squirrels, rats, mice), and broken windows/doors/locks presenting security risk. Up to £1,000 inc VAT per claim, maximum 3 claims per year. Your boiler must be serviced annually.

common_questions.question: Is storm damage to my fence covered?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood is specifically excluded

common_questions.question: What if my building work causes damage?
common_questions.answer: Loss or damage arising from the alteration or extension of the buildings is not covered. You must notify the insurer of any structural alterations.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured? - page 1; What are my obligations? - page 3

common_questions.question: How much business equipment is covered?
common_questions.answer: Business equipment is covered up to £15,000, but identity theft connected with your business, profession or occupation is excluded
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured? - page 1; What is not insured? - page 1

common_questions.question: Can I choose my own solicitor for Family Legal Protection claims?
common_questions.answer: Yes, once court proceedings are issued or if conflict of interest arises, but the insurer will only cover costs up to their standard advisers' rates. You must gain consent before incurring any legal advisers' costs.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover? - Optional Covers - page 2

common_questions.question: What happens if items are stolen from my car?
common_questions.answer: Theft from vehicles or craft is only covered if all windows and doors are closed, all doors and openings are securely locked, and all reasonable precautions have been taken to conceal the items from view
